abstract: High Falls Journal on High Falls, NY, where seven local residents in a community that has fewer than 300 households worked together to create tribute to artist Marc Chagall, who lived in High Falls for two years in 1940s; exhibition, now on display in converted town chapel, houses 8 reproductions of paintings Chagall finished in High Falls, as well as about 40 of his photographs and documents.
snippet: The curiosity of a group of local history buffs has led to an exhibition dedicated to Marc Chagall, who lived in High Falls, N.Y., in the 1940s.
lead_paragraph: The curiosity of a group of local history buffs has led to an exhibition dedicated to Marc Chagall, who lived in High Falls, N.Y., in the 1940s.

headline.main: After Years of Rumors, a Tribute to a Titan of Art
headline.print_headline: After Years of Rumors, A Tribute to a Titan of Art
headline.seo: High Falls Pays Tribute to Marc Chagall, a Onetime Resident
